lines.text: I'd love to visit your apartment.
My apartment? Well, why mine?
The answer should be quite obvious, shouldn't it?
The fact of the matter is, mine is quite disorganized. I've been having maid trouble, too.
Well, I'll tell you what. You take me to your apartment and I'll show you what I can do with a vacuum cleaner.

[Tom bumped into officer]
I'm sorry, officer, my eyes were on that girl.
Well, just glue them back in your head and keep moving.
I didn't finish with my wife's lawyers 'till after midnight.
You mean you and Leona still can't agree on a settlement?
Oh, yeah, she wants to split everything down the middle including my head.
You know, Harv, I hate to see you so hacked up. I wish there was something I could do.
Mary Leona. Get me off the alimony hook.
That good a friend I am not.
I'll give you three of my paintings in your apartment.
How much are they worth?
$25,000 a piece.
I have to take Leona?
Yeah.
Forget it.
Fairweather friend.
I want to meet you, just not head on.
Where to?
I don't know.
Do you wanna go home?
I am home.
What do you want me to do ? Drive you up the steps?
Call the police, Tom, she's after my paintings.
I'll be personally responsible for the paintings.
Somebody just stole your apartment, your name and you're going to be responsible for my paint... Call the police!
This is the girl who took my place.
Well, what's she doing in my place?
She won't let me in my place so I had to call your place my place.
Get her out of here, you hear! Out! Out!
Now, Harv, I've been working on her, now she's just starting to talk.
Now teach her how to walk and get her out of here!

[Becoming suspicious of an alcoholic drink he's made for her]
Say, what's the proportion of gin and quinine water in this drink?
Oh, I'd say about, uh... "even-Steven."

[starting to giggle]
I'd say it was more "Steven" than "even."
Look, why don't you make like a potato and get boiled?
30 in the morning deserves a punch in the face.

Harvey, I feel like a heel. For two weeks now, I've been spiking her drinks, playing on her sympathies, lurking around just waiting to take advantage. Would you want somebody to do that to your sister?
I sure would. My sister's single and pushing forty.
Could we be alone, please?

[in a seductive voice]
Oh, sure. What did you have in mind?
[Joan looks at Audrey, amazed]
I meant Joan.
